content: questions email inquiries@siouxsiestitches com materials 16 circular needles size us 8 worsted weight yarn of your choice in 5 colors scarf pictured used hobby lobby s i love this yarn in black 2 skeins keylime 1 white 1 orange neon 1 and willow yarns wash in lurid 1 1 stitch marker yarn needle size i/9 crochet hook gauge and sizing 18 stitches in 4 inches 4 5 stitches per inch but gauge is not super important to this project this was designed to be a long floor-dusting scarf if knitted as instructed scarf will be about 8 5 wide and 8 feet long not including fringe each colorblock is about 2 feet long if you want a smaller scarf use smaller needles and dk or sport weight yarn alternatively you could skip portions of the colorwork charts that you do not want included in your scarf evil cats and inverted crosses are not for everyone after all pattern notes scarf is knitted as one long tube charts are worked in the round from the bottom up for two colorblocks or until you reach the middle point of the scarf that will be at the back of the neck then you simply flip the charts upside down to knit the remaining two colorblocks this is so all the images are right-side-up when the scarf is worn i recommend stopping to weave in ends on the wrong side as you go since it can be difficult to turn the entire scarf inside out once it is finished i used a long-tail cast on and a regular bind off and then single crocheted the ends closed because the crocheted edge makes it easier to add fringe conversely you could do a provisional cast on and graft the ends closed if you want a smoother result start here with circular needles and green yarn cast on 72 stitches place marker join to knit in the round knit 2 rounds join black yarn and work all of chart 1 and chart 2 through row 57 cut green yarn join white yarn to work row 58 and 59 of chart 2 repeat all of chart 1 and chart 2 through row 57 cut white yarn join orange yarn to work row 58 and 59 of chart 2 **for the second half of the scarf flip the charts so you are working the designs from the top down continue to read the charts from right to left you will also be knitting the designs in the opposite color from the previous half for example the pumpkins on the first half of the scarf were either green or white with black backgrounds but for the second half of the scarf the pumpkins are going to be black with orange or purple as the background ** work chart 1 from row 48 to row 1 then work chart 2 from row 59 to row 1 work chart 1 from row 52 to row 51 break orange yarn join purple
